column6: The pulse is an expedient tactile method of determination of systolic blood pressure to a trained observer. Diastolic blood pressure is non-palpable and unobservable by tactile methods, occurring between heartbeats. 99-150 (0–3 months old) infants 89-120 (3 – 6 months)        infants 80-120 (6 – 12 months)        children  70-130 (1 – 10 years)        children over 10 years
